intro: Rytigynia pubescens, commonly known as the hairy rytigynia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rytigyniaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a yellow or greenish hue. Rytigynia pubescens is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
